TopicTitle: What will you do first in 1.0?

Articles.Content: Click "Start Game" on the main screen.

> 
> Build new engines, including fairings as parts.

Hell yeah! It will be possible to build much smaller reliable ones with the new small landing wheels. I cannot wait!
Make a low part count soyuz!

> 
> After the huge amount of work and large array of features SQUAD will have put into this update, you will disregard this due to "no planets". A teensy bit rude and disrespectful?

that "large array of features" is pretty much resources and a proper aerodynamic model
Wait for the 1.0 StockBugFixMod and an update for KER while derping around.
type ./KSP.x86\_64
i will build fairings. And shed tears of joy

What are you going to do when 1.0 is officially released? 

For me, I would try out the new re-entry effects and see if my ship explodes in mid-air, trying out the new parts and definitely trying out the overhauled aerodynamics (and hoping I can create a stable plane since I'm not very good at constructing planes).

So, what will you do?
[Ahem.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113872-What-will-you-do-first-in-1-0)
I searched across the forums but I couldn't find one the same as this. I guess I was wrong...
I will test out reentry heat by entering Eve's atmosphere at around 87km/s
I will be refilling them tanks on all the bodies! Especially Laythe!
When 1.0 comes out, I will merge threads on duplicate topics. (I'm getting an early start.)

I'll try launching my most un-aerodynamic monstrosities, and see how long they fly before ripping apart. Like this Eve mission here...

On topic: i play the interstellar "way of game" in the tradition of scott manley, and pick a bunch of mods that seem interesting and/or necessary at the start. Add some basic rules for this career and the pledge to play with "minimal" use of timewarp by using alarmclock and some fun is unavoidable. 

This means around 20 mods (basics like FAR, realchute, DR, TAC LS) plus new great mods or those that change my goalposts like Karbonite (See? Your health is important to me Roverdude after what you said on reddit). ATM and opengl are necessary in .90 and i hope the performance will become at least as good or better as it was in .25 when 1.0 hits. I will and i like to play 1.0 in vanilla, and i am pretty sure it will be great and the sky wont fall this time either despite all the doubts around here. And after some time the mods will be back and i am pretty sure FAR and TAC LS will be among them ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I will watch reviewers tear 1.0 to shreds.

This. With over 2500 hours playing KSP, I haven't played more than one hour in the past year, the magic just isn't there anymore. The game was so revolutionary and fun when it came out, that I didn't mind the instability, ctds, bugs, and glitches; but as time went by and the game took shape, none of those things were fixed. When it hit beta, I thought that Squad may now finally focus on polishing the game.. only to see a pittance of a beta phase (1 beta version really?)

Firing up the current build does not give me the impression of a finished game AT ALL, and I shudder to think what Angry Joe, IGN, and others will do to the game that was pretty much my gaming life for 2012 and 2013.

> 
> This. With over 2500 hours playing KSP, I haven't played more than one hour in the past year, the magic just isn't there anymore.

It's easy to get burnt out after so many hours. I wouldn't feel to bad.
